title: Neighbor demands teenager's cat for his son who ‘needs it more,’ accuses them of being entitled when they refuse to give it up: ‘There is no shortage of cats available for adoption at the local shelter. He needs to go there’
description: Look, I get it, and I know if you're here reading this, you do too. Cats are the best. Whether it's the majestic fluffball living with you (or, let's be honest, the one you pay rent to) or a sassy stray you spotted crossing the street, cats are universal emotional support creatures. Yes, all of them. All the time. Even when a stray ignores me like I'm invisible, the snub feels oddly validating and injects a little serotonin into my day.  That being said, my cat, whom I physically gave birth to and have definitely shared more meaningful moments with than most humans, is mine. That's not negotiable. Now, imagine someone walking up to your door, skipping the small talk, and asking for your cat on the grounds that their kid needs it more than you do. That's exactly what this neighbor did.
author: Etai Eshet
excerpt: Neighbor demands teenager's cat for his son who ‘needs it more,’ accuses them of being entitled when they refuse to give it up: ‘There is no shortage of cats available for adoption at the local shelter. He needs to go there’ - World's largest collection of cat memes and other animals
text: He walked up at someone's doorstep, demanding they surrender their cat to his son, as if pets are public goods to be redistributed according to need. And when refused, he took offense at being denied, accusing the cat's owner of entitlement. It's a special kind of ridiculous to not only make such a request but then to act offended when it’s met with laughter and a firm no. Cats aren’t items to be borrowed or traded for the greater good. They’re family, and you don’t give up family to someone who seems to think Meow means Mine.
